Package javelin.model.unit

Class Combatant

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.unit.Combatant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Building
    public class Combatant
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    A Combatant is an in-game unit, like the enemies in the battlefield or the named player characters. It contains the data that changes frequently during the course of battle, speeding up the cloning process for BattleNode replication by sharing the same reference to Monster among cloned instances.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • source

        public Monster source
        The statistics for this monster.

      • ap

        public float ap
        Action points. 1 represent a full-round action, .5 a move-equivalent or attack action and so on.

      • location

        public int[] location
        XY coordenates. Better used as an array since this enabl es more programmatic way of handling directions, like deltas.

      • Combatant

        public Combatant​(Monster sourcep,
                 boolean generatespells)
        Parameters:
        generatespells - if true will create spells for this monster based on his Monster.spellcr. This is essentially a temporary measure to allow 1.0 monster who would have spell powers to use the currently implemented spells TODO

      • surprise

        public int surprise()
        Returns:
        0 if not surprised or the corresponding AC penalty if flat-footed.

      • rollinitiative

        public void rollinitiative()
        Rolls a d20, sums Monster.initiative and initializes ap according to the result. This also adds a random positive or negative value (below 1% of an action point) to help keep the initiative order stable by preventing collisions (such as 2 units having exactly 0 ap). Given that AP values are padded to the user and that normal initiative works in 5% steps and normal actions don't usually go finer than 10% AP cost, this is entirely harmless when it comes to game balance. If you want an unit to enter battle mid-way, you can set a starting value to ap representing the current point in time and then call this method.

      • getnumericstatus

        public int getnumericstatus()
        Returns:

      • damage

        public void damage​(int damage,
                   int reduction)
        Simpler version of damage(int, BattleState, int). Just takes the given amount from hp while making sure it stays positive.
        Parameters:
        reduction - Usually Monster.dr or Monster.energyresistance, or 0 to ignore.

      • postupgrade

        public void postupgrade()
        Some Upgrades need further interaction from a human after they are applied. This method deals with all of these cleanups.
        See Also:
        #postupgradeautomatic(boolean, Upgrade)

      • postupgradeautomatic

        public void postupgradeautomatic()
        Like #postupgrade(boolean, Upgrade) but this handles all of these scenarios automatically - either because the player might not care enoug to hand-pick the the outcome or because we are upgrading an NPC like with #upgrade(Collection).

        public void act​(BattleState s)
        Passive Monsters don't rely on BattleAi, and use this instead.

      • gettopspeed

        public int gettopspeed​(BattleState s)
        Parameters:
        s - If not null, will verify the current position and if Square.flooded, returns Monster.swim. If null, will never return swimming speed.
        Returns:
        The highest relevant spped available (in feet).
        See Also:
        Monster.burrow, Monster.fly, Monster.walk

      • roll

        public int roll​(Skill s)
        Returns:
        Rolls a d20 and adds the given Skill.getbonus(Combatant).Returns 0 if cannot use this skill.
        See Also:
        Skill.canuse(Combatant), taketen(Skill)

      • taketen

        public int taketen​(Skill s)
        This should be preferred to roll(Skill) on any circumstance where retrying is possible. We don't want players to bore/game/grind themselves by retrying an action 20 times until they reach the best possible result.
        Returns:
        Takes an automatic 10 on a d20 ("take 10" rule) and adds the given Skill.getbonus(Combatant). Returns 0 if cannot use this skill.
        See Also:
        Skill.canuse(Combatant)

      • decipher

        public boolean decipher​(Spell s)
        Returns:
        true if can decioher a Spell from a Scroll or Wand.

      • concentrate

        public boolean concentrate​(Spell s)

      • perceive

        public int perceive​(boolean flyingbonus,
                    boolean weatherpenalty,
                    boolean periodpenalty)
        Parameters:
        flyingbonus - true if flying creatures get a bonus for seeing farther.
        weatherpenalty - true if Weather should influence this roll.
        periodpenalty - Penalty according to Monster.vision and Javelin.getperiod().
        Returns:
        Total Perception roll bonus modifier as in Perception.getbonus(Combatant).

      • getac

        public int getac()
        Returns:
        Effective armor class.

      • flank

        public boolean flank​(Combatant target,
                     BattleState s)
        See d20 flanking rules.
        Parameters:
        target - Unit that is potentially being flanked.
        Returns:
        true if there is a third unit flanking the target.

      • upgrade

        public boolean upgrade​(Upgrade u)
        Parameters:
        u - Applies this, taking into consideration validation (using an internal clone) and xp.
        Returns:
        false if couldn't be upgraded or not enough XP. If true, also substracts xp and updates Monster.cr.

      • rollinitiative

        public void rollinitiative​(float ap)
        Parameters:
        ap - Rolls initative on top of this Action Point value then updates ap and initialap.

      • pay

        public int pay()
        Note that this does not deduct from Squad.gold at all.
        Returns:
        How much to pay daily if this is a mercenary. 0 otherwise.
        See Also:
        MercenariesGuild.getfee(Monster), Squad.paymercenaries()

      • gettouchac

        public int gettouchac()
        Depends on Monster.armor being kept up-to-date.
        Returns:
        Armor Class disregarding any armour.
